section.title: id
section.para: Type: Identifier ( only characters allowed are letters, digits and the following symbols `-_` )

Resource identifier. Must be unique among resource siblings (so no two child of a resource can have the same id). For example if you needed a package to be installed before it's service is started, you could use

section.title: uid
section.para: Resource unique identifier. This is automatically generated and cannot be manually specified. It's value is equals to [parent's id].[resource id]

section.title: before
section.para: Specifies resources which this resource should execute before. For example if you needed a package to be installed before it's service is started, you could use

section.title: after
section.para: Specifies resources which this resource should execute after. For example if you needed a package to be installed before it's service is started, you could use
section.programlisting: core.service { after="@id = configfile" } core.file { "configfile": path="/etc/myserver.conf", before="@id = myserver" }

section.title: requires
section.para: This can be used to specify a dependency on one or more resources, which will be automatically created if no matching resource is found. The format is a command separated list of resource types with potential attributes equality matching between brackets ( if a resource is created, those attributes will be set in the resource ).

Example: this will cause a resource of type test:type1 to be created, as well as a resource of type test.type2 which would have the attribute 'test' assigned as 'bla'. Both would be set as dependencies of the test.test resource.
Example: In this example no resource would be created since 'test.type1' already exists. It would be added as a dependency of 'test:test'

section.title: notify
section.para: Specified resources this will be notified after this resource is executed.

section.title: subscribe
section.para: Specified resources which execution will cause this resource to be notified..
